node.text: Battery Power for Envy
node.Log: KVEBATT - Envy Battery Troubleshooter.

node.text: Agent Note: If the battery was purchased seperately as an accessory, it will come with its own separate warranty. Please log an accessory battery under the battery not the notebook. Click here to view the HP and Compaq branded Accessories Policy.
node.Log: Reading the Accessories Policy.

node.text: Which best describes the problem being experienced?
node.Log: Identify the problem.

node.text: Envy 17 - 8 Cell Battery is not detected on unit. Unable to run Battery check.
node.Log: Envy 17 - 8 Cell Battery is not detected on unit. Unable to run Battery check.

node.text: I am receiving the HP Battery Alert on boot.
node.Log: HP Battery Alert on boot.

node.text: I am not able to boot into Windows and (may) have a problem with my battery.
node.Log: Notebook is unable to boot into Windows.

node.text: I am able to boot into Windows and (may) have a problem with my battery.
node.Log: Notebook can boot into Windows.

node.text: My battery charge light does not indicate the battery is charging.
node.Log: Charge light does not turn on.

node.text: There is a problem with the Battery Slice power gauge.
node.Log: There is a problem with the Battery Slice power gauge.

node.text: The Windows power status icon reports a different overall charge than the charge reported individually for each battery.
node.Log: Windows power status icon indicates different charge than the battery is reporting.

node.text: The Battery is loose, not connecting properly, or is not recognized by the notebook.
node.Log: Battery Slice not properly connected or recognized by the notebook.

node.Log: This tree last updated: Jul-01-2011

node.text: Please go to hp.com and update BIOS to latest version F.13 or higher.

node.Log: Message may appear as follows:

node.text: 'The system has detected the storage capacity of the battery stated below to be very low. For optimal performance, this battery may need to be replaced.'
node.Log: Information on message.

node.text: Notebook Models June 2008 and later include a new feature called the HP Battery Alert. Click here for more information.
node.Log: Information on HP Battery Alert.

node.Log: Battery Slice.

node.Log: Battery Slice is being used.

node.Log: The Primary Battery is not properly connecting or is not recognized by the notebook.

node.text: 'Secondary' appears in the alert message. (The message is referring to the Battery Slice.)

node.text: Envy 13, 14, 15 - issues using HP Battery Check or testing battery using F2 Diagnostics.

node.text: Envy 13, 14, 15 and 17 - Windows Error - Consider Replacing Your Battery.
node.Log: Windows Error on replacing your battery.

node.text: Envy 17 - Microsoft Windows operating system is unable to detect battery due to Ship-mode.
node.Log: Envy 17 - Microsoft Windows operating system is unable to detect battery due to Ship-mode.

node.text: Download and install the latest (F2) HP System Diagnostics (UEFI) installer from HP.com for the system.

node.text: Click here to continue to the Envy No Power or Boot logic flow.
node.Log: Click here to continue to the Envy No Power or Boot logic flow.

node.text: The state of the LED indicates that the AC adapter is present and that the battery may be fully charged or not connected.
node.Log: LED indicates AC adapter present. Battery may be fully charged.

node.text: The state of the LED indicates that the battery is charging.
node.Log: LED indicates the battery is charging.

node.text: Note: This battery LED activity only applies to the Envy15. The light will not flash on an Envy13 except for a brief period after a battery is connected when the AC is already connected.
node.Log: Note: This battery LED activity only applies to the Envy15. The light will not flash on an Envy13 except for a brief period after a battery is connected when the AC is already connected.

node.text: The battery has reached a low level or a critical level. There could also be a battery error.
node.Log: Battery has reached low or critical level. May also be a battery error.

node.text: This indicates the battery currently has between a '25%' and '100%' charge. Each light represents a '25%' charge incriment.
node.Log: Battery is from 25 to 100 percent charged.

node.text: This indicates the Battery Slice charge has reached a low level.
node.Log: Battery Slice charge has reached a low level.

node.text: Please press the square button next to the battery power gauge.
node.Log: Pressing button next to power gauge.

node.text: The Battery Slice (Secondary battery in battery status window), when an internal (Primary battery in status window) battery is present, will only charge once the internal one has reached an '89%' or higher charge by default.
node.Log: The Battery Slice (Secondary battery in battery status window), when an internal (Primary battery in status window) battery is present, will only charge once the internal one has reached an '89%' or higher charge by default.

node.text: Windows reports a total charge based on the charge and capacities of both batteries when present. Click here for information on the accuracy of the battery meter.
